Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 11:45AM ingoodcompany wrote: I received a care package when I had my BMX and was SO thrilled that my friend put so much thought into it. Flowers are great, but the care package made me feel even more concerned for. In addition to the items mentioned she put magazines, coffee, lotions etc. It was not created with a theme of BC ( i.e pink) it was just a theme of thoughtful items. Loved it!!
Posts.Title: What to include in a care package for a friend? GreenSeaTurtle nicholewilliams

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2011 09:36AM ingoodcompany wrote: After we told our kids I spoke to their school counslers so in csase they seemed distracted or upset they would know what was going on. I spoke to my son's football coach and my daughters softball coach also. I knew the kids both had  great support systems in place. My mom and sister have both had BC many years ago and that helped the kids realize it was going to be okay. Good luck to you and remember to breathe.....
Posts.Title: how do I tell my kids spunkyboobster Miller1353

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2011 10:01PM - edited Sep 21, 2011 10:02PM by ingoodcompany I am glad to have found this thread!!! I suppose it is true that people just don't know how to react or what to say to someone when they hear their cancer news. I have been so disappointed by people that I have been "friends" with for years and have comforted in their time of need. I have learned to ask for support when I need it.
